data.title: Wonderful flavors
data.text: First time experience with Indian food.  Stopped in for lunch and had their buffet.  Lots of choices for sampling. All were fresh, hot, and very tasty!  Price on the buffet was great to.  Restaurant clean, service friendly.  Would certainly stop in again on another trip through Elk Grove.

data.title: Indian cuisine lunch buffet worth it
data.text: I took my family here for their lunch buffet. The price was really good and they had quite a nice selection of dishes. Many were spicy but not so much that you couldn't taste anything. My daughter loved the butter chicken with naan. I liked the mixed veggies and yellow curry with chicken.  The sauces provided were tasty, especially the mint sauce. Lastly, the rice pudding was yummy but a bit too sweet for my taste. Overall service was great too.

data.title: Authentic Tasty Indian food
data.text: Having sampled some of the other Indian fare in Sacramento, I expected the same average fare when I first went into Maharani.  Let me tell you, this food blows all the other Sacramento Indian restaurants away; and the service is very good as well!  Their best dish is the Lamb curry it's to DIE FOR!!!  it is very tasty, and their Indian Chow Mein is fantastic as well.  If you like Indian food and live in Sacramento, try them, you will not be disappointed.

data.title: Pretty Good!
data.text:
Decided to try Maharani since it was in our discount book. Very happy we did.

Located in old Elk Grove in probably was once a fast food restaurant. Owners (looks like one hard working family) have created a very nice interior.

I had a great chicken tandoori and my wife had a lamb curry dish. We asked for mild seasoning and very glad we did. It was still pretty spicy but just right. We also tried a chai and yogurt drinks; which were fantastic! Other patrons seemed to be enjoying there meals and the take out counter was doing a very brisk business.

Waitstaff was extremely attentive a polite. Huge menu selection. Worth checking out, and I'm sure we will return again.

data.title: Delicious food
data.text:
We used to visit this restaurant when it was located on Broadway in Sacramento.  The food is just excellent -- I don't like hot spicy food so I always request mild spices.  My sister enjoys spicier food, so she goes for the stronger level of spices. 
Their chicken tandoori is to die for.  The sweet lassi is a very light and refreshing drink.  Also their rice pudding with pistachio nuts is just wonderful.  There are so many delicious dishes -- hard to mention them all.  The staff is always friendly and our visits to the restaurants are always very happy evenings.  One evening we noticed a young man that entered the restaurant and it appeared that he might have been asking for help -- money.  The owner very quietly packed a box of food and gave it to the young man.  I was so impressed.

data.title: A cornucopia of flavors and very good service
data.text: This restaurant is quaint and has a family atmosphere. Its dishes are fabulous and varied. The service is always friendly and attentive. Try their tandori chicken and any of their curries. Great place

data.title: The food was delicious
data.text: They have a buffet for lunch, & provide only menu options for dinner. The beat thing I've had there is their butter chicken. It is far superior to other places. I had a restaurant I loved that made it, & I happened to come to Maharani's and I haven't gone back to the other place since. Their garlic naan is always something I order as a side.

data.title: Belly up to the (Buffet) Bar, Boys!!
data.text:
Ok, so I despise buffet lines as a concept. Fine dining is about taste & Smell & presentation and plating. At a buffet line, it's about building a mountain on your plate and sticking your flag on top. 

With that said, this is one of the best Indian buffets I've had. It's pricy at $10.00 no drink but they make up for it in quality. The Tanduri chicken ,cut funny ,is tasty although I didn't care for the rice or the Naan. They have a lamb dish that is so so but the other offering are nice. 

If your are into quality indian fare, there are better, non buffet indian restaurants. However, if you skipped breakfast and need to make up for lost time, I'd recommend here!!! $10.00 for brunch is do-able for me!!!

data.title: Yummy menu!
data.text:
I'm NOT a buffet fan so I avoided the buffet option when my daughter and I stopped in for a late lunch. It was close to closing time but we were treated politely, served quickly, and not rushed.

The menu is extensive with lots of delicious options for my vegetarian preferences and plenty of delicious options for my carnivore daughter.

The papadams were a lovely, light surprise while we waited for our entrees with two lovely sauces to choose from. The entrees were delicious, fresh, and generous with plenty to take home for later.

A place I'll enjoy again.

data.title: Great restaurant in Elk Grove
data.text: This is a real treat to have an Indian restaurant of this quality in Elk Grove. Very nice décor and ambience. Have been to lunch buffet several times. good quality, selection  and price. Went for Valentines Day and had a spectacular meal for under $26 including  tax and tip. Great service and no rushing. I am impressed.

data.title: Really Nice Restaraunt!!
data.text: Nice restaurant.  I picked up food for a couple of co-workers who have never had Indian food.  They were amazed with what I brought for them.  They were really happy and are now huge fans of Indian food.

data.title: Great food
data.text: My husband and I love coming here for lunch. They have a lunch buffet ($7.99). The food is always good. My girls love the chicken curry, rice, bread, and this rice pudding for desert. I love everything but I have to get an extra cup of ice water cause some of the food is spicy. They don't always serve the same food for buffet so it's a hit and miss but for the most part all the food is awesome.

data.title: Indian food at its Best
data.text:
This buffet has lots of choices for a vegetarian like me.
The bread, rice, and Tika chats are great.
Every time we go we are treated to a variety of different delicacies.

data.title: Great new neighborhood Indian restaurant
data.text: It was a Friday nite and the place was packed and there were 5 people in the take-out line, but we were seated promptly. The menu has lots of variety and prices are downright cheap (especially the Thali dinner), but the food was very good. I particularly liked the Lamb Korba. Also a good inexpensive wines by the glass. Only complaint was the service was a bit slow.
